localizedDescriptions.en: Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Summary information about the significant health-related problems found in family members.
Details about the presence of a specific problem or diagnosis in family members.

annotations.comment: If the problem has a genetic predisposition within families, then only genetic relatives should be considered as part of this data. If the problem has psychosocial or environmental effects then non-genetic family members may also be included.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identification of the significant problem or diagnosis in the family overall.

annotations.comment: This is the problem for which aggregated data involving all family members will be collected. Coding of the index problem with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about the presence of a specific problem or diagnosis in family members.

annotations.comment: If the problem has a genetic predisposition within families, then only genetic relatives should be considered as part of this data. If the problem has psychosocial or environmental effects then non-genetic family members may also be included.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identification of the significant problem or diagnosis in the family overall.

annotations.comment: This is the problem for which aggregated data involving all family members will be collected. Coding of the index problem with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative description about occurrence of the problem or diagnosis in family members.
Details about a specific family member.

annotations.comment: The data elements in this cluster will relate to the individual identified either by name or by alias. Repeat the use of the cluster for other family members.

children.name: Kondisi orang tua

localizedDescriptions.en: The degree of relationship between the subject of care and the family member.

annotations.comment: If the 'Relationship' data element uses pre-coordinated terms that include the degree of relationship, then this data element is redundant.

children.name: Riwayat penyakit orang tua

localizedDescriptions.en: Detail about problems or diagnoses for the family member.

annotations.comment: If more detail is required, suggest using EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis or the ACTION.procedure archetype and specifying the 'Subject of Care' as the family member, rather than the subject of the health record.

children.aqlPath: /content[openEHR-EHR-SECTION.adhoc.v1,'Baseline']/items[openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.family_history.v2,'Riwayat Penyakit Pasien & Keluarga']/data[at0001]/items[at0003,'Riwayat Penyakit Ayah']/items[at0008,'Riwayat penyakit orang tua']

children.name: Riwayat penyakit

localizedDescriptions.en: Identification of the significant problem or diagnosis in the identified family member.

annotations.comment: Coding of the family member's problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible. May link from this data element to a detailed record of a Problem/Diagnosis using the EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis archetype with the Subject of Care set to the family member, not to the patient.

localizedDescriptions.en: The subjective clinical history of the subject of care as recorded directly by the subject, or reported to a clinician by the subject or a carer.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Narrative description of the story or clinical history for the subject of care.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Narrative description of the story or clinical history for the subject of care.
Details about a specific health-related event.

annotations.comment: For example: a poisoning, overdose or trauma.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identification of the event that occurred.
A narrative description of the event.
The time between the event and the time of clinical assessment.
Narrative description the context and circumstances surrounding the event.
Identification of factors contributing to the occurrence of the event.
Additional narrative about the health event, not captured in other fields.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Narrative description of the story or clinical history for the subject of care.
Details about a specific health-related event.

annotations.comment: For example: a poisoning, overdose or trauma.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identification of the event that occurred.
A narrative description of the event.
The time between the event and the time of clinical assessment.
Narrative description the context and circumstances surrounding the event.
Identification of factors contributing to the occurrence of the event.
Additional narrative about the health event, not captured in other fields.
The local measurement of arterial blood pressure which is a surrogate for arterial pressure in the systemic circulation.

annotations.comment: Most commonly, use of the term 'blood pressure' refers to measurement of brachial artery pressure in the upper arm.

localizedDescriptions.en: Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Peak systemic arterial blood pressure  - measured in systolic or contraction phase of the heart cycle.
Minimum systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in the diastolic or relaxation phase of the heart cycle.
Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the blood pressure measurement.
Measurement of the body weight of an individual.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
The weight of the individual.
Additional narrative about the measurement of Body weight, not captured in other fields.
Description of the state of dress of the person at the time of weighing.
Without any clothes.
Wearing only a nappy - which may add significantly to weight.
Clothing which will not add to weight significantly.
Clothing which may add significantly to weight.
Clothing which may add significantly to weight, including shoes.
Record any issues or factors that may impact on the measurement of body weight eg timing in menstrual cycle, timing of recent bowel motion or noting of amputation.
Height, or body length, is measured from crown of head to sole of foot.

annotations.comment: Height is measured with the individual in a standing position and body length in a recumbent position.

localizedDescriptions.en: Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
The length of the body from crown of head to sole of foot.
Additional narrative about the measurement, not captured in other fields.
Position of individual when measured.
Height is measured standing on both feet with weight distributed evenly, heels together and both buttocks and heels in contact with a vertical back board.
Length is measured in a fully extended, recumbent position with the pelvis flat, legs extended and feet flexed.
Narrative description of any issues or factors that may impact on the measurement.

annotations.comment: For example: noting of amputation.

localizedDescriptions.en:
Usually the first length measurement, recorded soon after birth. This event will only be used once per health record
.
The length of the body from crown of head to sole of foot.
Additional narrative about the measurement, not captured in other fields.
Position of individual when measured.
Height is measured standing on both feet with weight distributed evenly, heels together and both buttocks and heels in contact with a vertical back board.
Length is measured in a fully extended, recumbent position with the pelvis flat, legs extended and feet flexed.
Narrative description of any issues or factors that may impact on the measurement.

annotations.comment: For example: noting of amputation.
